The Wanderer BOT 21-02-2023 03:22
Somewhere just outside of Barovia watching in through a shimmering cup of tea. "Come sisters, watch with me as we hedge... Alright now stop sobbing that won't make a difference.... No, I can not do that here as I have told you repeatedly, I am too detached now come watch with me sisters as we see what our champions can do to further our goals... Fine if you won't watch them I'll have to narrate it for you, I know you want to know how they are doing anyways." The gentleman and his lovely Porcelain triplets sit in a run down living hall across from a roaring fireplace with their favorite tea and snacks. "They are displaced it seems, but their path will meet soon, in the wilds just outside of Barovia commons. Hmm? They seem pissed, yes, they don't know the truth yet. Just that their dear friend is gone and they blame Morgantha. Yes, it does suit our needs just fine those pastries will soon be gone I'd hope now hush, I think ones already noticed. You girls really do have a good eye for talent." He chuckles as Georg looks unknowingly at his scrying eye in the sky. From this view we see the group meeting up. Ric and Lars both full of fury, Lila begrudgingly following Georg for reasons she does not understand but The Wanderer easily recognizes and an extra, peculiar how were they wrapped up into this? Regardless of reasons, circumstances and creeds they are together now with a clear mission. The makers of the pastries must be stopped by whatever means but they are also woefully powerful. The trek to Bonegrinder may not be a far one but the sun is setting and we all know what goes bump in the night. Enter Players half an hour outside the gates to Barovia.

Georg BOT 21-02-2023 03:30
Enter Georg and his silver drake companion "Lila... you don't have to come and risk your life! You probably feel some sort of sacred duty to watch over your shadar brethren, and I have to go because I gave someone my word that I would try and stop the pastries from being distributed," he mindlessly fingers his scrimshaw token, now hung like an amulet on a hemp string around his neck. "But if something were to happen to you... I would blame myself forever." Suddenly, he feels goosebumps on his neck and a strange chill run down his back. He looks around, up at the sky, toward the distant treeline, and shrugs. "Do you ever get the feeling like you're being watched? Such a peculiar feeling." (edited)

Is it possible that doubt is beginning to creep into the black heart devoted to the Raven Queen. "Regardless, my reasons for being here are my own," she says with an air of finality. "As for being watched, I have grown accustomed to the feeling. Her Majesty's ravens would often watch us. If you had nothing to hide then you had nothing to fear."

Enter Kestrel Kestrel follows along, the goblin clutching her newly-enhanced spear as she quickens her stride. She's used to keeping up with taller folk anyway, but it doesn't hurt that she's fueled by the grim knowledge that she was right. This place hasn't been anything but terrible, and free treats seemed like a clear trap to her from the start. Now that she's commissioned some things and put her skills to use creating the rest, Kestrel doesn't see the point in delaying action any longer. And look at that, there seem to be people of like mind gathering. Her piercing yellow eyes flit to each person, drake included. "I've never not felt that I was being watched in this place. Everything here is so...hungry. Better assume that we're always being watched, whether the watchers are hostile or not." But they probably are, she quietly adds to herself. "You're doing something about those damned pastries? I want in. I knew nothing free around here could lead to anything good, and there's only so many times I can say 'I told you so' before it gets boring. Action, I can handle."

Georg BOT 14-05-2023 02:24
Georg ducks out of the way for a few of the rocks, but lets the next couple pelt him directly, some of the breaking skin and drawing blood. Looking down at the mass pile of bodies, some of them whom he was well acquainted with, he feels a dull ache spread painfully from the pit of his stomach into his limbs. The stones hitting him, bruising him, bleeding him... Feel like penitence. Feels like the pain may be helping ground him in the reality of the consequences of his actions. He looks at Riannoc and Lila, both storming off in different directions, and lets out a sob. One sob was the first brick that came loose in a dam and out comes a louder, more animalistic sound of mourning. Flashbacks to the one hundred year war in Khorvaire and the countless innocents that have died in every warring nation comes hot and vivid in his mind. "Thank you, Kestrel, for watching me back." He manages to squeak out between sobs. He looks at Lars, afraid to meet his eyes, and feeling inexplicably embarrassed to cry in front of him. He picks up his enchanted scimitar from off the ground and also sprints off in the direction of Krezk. Even Vallaki is too close to Barovia for him to be able to find comfort, the Drake quickly scurrying after him. Exit Georg
